db:abstract.db:para: The QSslKey class provides an interface for private and public keys.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QSslKey is part of Network Programming APIsslshared

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QSslKey provides a simple API for managing keys.

db:section.db:title: QSslKey::QSslKey()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null key.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QSslKey::QSslKey(Qt::HANDLE handle, QSsl::KeyType type = QSsl::PrivateKey)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QSslKey from a valid native key handle. type specifies whether the key is public or private.
QSslKey will take ownership for this key and you must not free the key using the native library.

db:section.db:title: QSslKey::QSslKey(QIODevice *device, QSsl::KeyAlgorithm algorithm, QSsl::EncodingFormat encoding = QSsl::Pem, QSsl::KeyType type = QSsl::PrivateKey, const QByteArray &passPhrase = QByteArray())
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QSslKey by reading and decoding data from a device using a specified algorithm and encoding format. type specifies whether the key is public or private.
If the key is encrypted then passPhrase is used to decrypt it.
After construction, use isNull() to check if device provided a valid key.

db:section.db:title: QSslKey::QSslKey(const QByteArray &encoded, QSsl::KeyAlgorithm algorithm, QSsl::EncodingFormat encoding = QSsl::Pem, QSsl::KeyType type = QSsl::PrivateKey, const QByteArray &passPhrase = QByteArray())
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QSslKey by decoding the string in the byte array encoded using a specified algorithm and encoding format. type specifies whether the key is public or private.
If the key is encrypted then passPhrase is used to decrypt it.
After construction, use isNull() to check if encoded contained a valid key.

db:section.db:title: QSslKey::QSslKey(const QSslKey &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs an identical copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QSslKey::~QSslKey()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QSslKey object.

db:section.db:title: QSsl::KeyAlgorithm QSslKey::algorithm() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the key algorithm.

db:section.db:title: void QSslKey::clear()
db:section.db:para: Clears the contents of this key, making it a null key.

db:section.db:title: Qt::HANDLE QSslKey::handle() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the native key handle, if there is one, else nullptr.
You can use this handle together with the native API to access extended information about the key.

db:warning.db:para: Use of this function has a high probability of being non-portable, and its return value may vary across platforms, and between minor Qt releases.

db:section.db:title: bool QSslKey::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this is a null key; otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: int QSslKey::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the length of the key in bits, or -1 if the key is null.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QSslKey::swap(QSslKey &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this ssl key with other. This operation is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QSslKey::toDer(const QByteArray &passPhrase = QByteArray()) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the key in DER encoding.
The passPhrase argument should be omitted as DER cannot be encrypted. It will be removed in a future version of Qt.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QSslKey::toPem(const QByteArray &passPhrase = QByteArray()) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the key in PEM encoding. The result is encrypted with passPhrase if the key is a private key and passPhrase is non-empty.

db:section.db:title: QSsl::KeyType QSslKey::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of the key (i.e., PublicKey or PrivateKey).

db:section.db:title: bool QSslKey::operator!=(const QSslKey &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this key is not equal to key other; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QSslKey &QSslKey::operator=(const QSslKey &other)
db:section.db:para: Copies the contents of other into this key, making the two keys identical.
Returns a reference to this QSslKey.

db:section.db:title: bool QSslKey::operator==(const QSslKey &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this key is equal to other; otherwise returns false.
